quests:
Each "World" file has a quests array, with a challenge to complete with jq.
this is the beginning of your jq journey.

Start by running 'jq --help' on the command line. Look for the example and try 
running it. Save the output of the example by adding '> questlog/00-0.json' to 
the end of the example command.

If you need a hint, run `cat W00-intro.json | jq '.hints[0][0]'` on the command line.

To test your result, run './doquest'

When you're ready to move on, run `jq -r '.quests[1]' W00-intro.json`

Some things to know:

You should output these quests with the "raw" option (i.e. `cat W00-intro.json | jq -r '.quests[1].
hints:
The result should look something like `echo ___ | jq ___ > questlog/00-0.json` 

Run `cat W00-intro.json | jq '.hints[0][1]' -r` For the next hint.
